intro: Paraphlomis tomentosocapitata, commonly known as the hairy-headed parsertail, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ethnobotany.
